page.title: 07Solihull Barons Ice Hockey
page.content: 1985 saw millions of B.B.C. television sport's fans watch Solihull Barons Ice Hockey Club play an historic cup game against Streathem Redskins, beating them for the first time in front of a packed 3000 crowd at Solihull's Hobs Moat Ice Rink. A few weeks later, the T.V. audience watched as the Barons narrowly lost to Durham in the semi-finals of the cup. These performances were incredible because, only three years before, the Barons were just a group of youngsters keen on Ice Hockey and watched only by their parents. But, following a change in management, sponsors were found to finance Canadian players and The Barons have become one of Britain's most feared teams. The Barons, Solihull's best supported team, have high hopes for a successful promotion campaign next season.
